relevant_findings.lung_fields: basilar rales in the right lung field, decreased breath sounds throughout both lung fields
relevant_findings.ECG: couplets, intermittent ventricular tachycardia with polymorphic waveforms, prolonged QTc approximately 520 msec, ST-segment elevations in leads V2-V4

relevant_findings.jugular_venous_pressure: 10 cm of water without a Kussmaul sign or hepatojugular reflux
relevant_findings.heart: diffuse point of maximal impulse, holosystolic murmur (grade 2/6) loudest over the apex
relevant_findings.abdomen: distention with decreased bowel sounds, liver span of 8 cm
relevant_findings.extremities: cool with 1+ pulses, erythematous macular rash in a shawl-like distribution and palmar erythema

relevant_findings.echocardiography: marked biventricular hypertrophy, severe mitral-valve regurgitation, biatrial enlargement, dilatation of inferior vena cava and hepatic vein, left ventricular ejection fraction 54%, small posterior pericardial effusion

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Echocardiographic findings were consistent with prior examinations but noted worsening in terms of biventricular hypertrophy and regurgitation severity.
